org.hps.readout.ecal

Class FADCEcalReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ecal.TriggerableDriver
        • org.hps.readout.ecal.EcalReadoutDriver<RawCalorimeterHit>
          • org.hps.readout.ecal.FADCEcalReadoutDriver

  • public class FADCEcalReadoutDriver
extends EcalReadoutDriver<RawCalorimeterHit>
    Performs readout of ECal hits. Simulates time evolution of preamp output pulse.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • setAddNoise

        public void setAddNoise(boolean addNoise)
        Add noise (photoelectron statistics and readout/preamp noise) to hits before adding them to the analog pipeline.
        Parameters:
        addNoise - True to add noise, default of false.

      • setConstantTriggerWindow

        public void setConstantTriggerWindow(boolean constantTriggerWindow)
        Sets the trigger-path hit processing algorithm.
        Parameters:
        constantTriggerWindow - True for 2014+ FADC behavior, false for test run behavior. True by default.

      • setFixedGain

        public void setFixedGain(double fixedGain)
        Override the ECal gains set in the conditions system with a single uniform value.
        Parameters:
        fixedGain - Units of MeV/(ADC counts in pulse integral). Negative value causes the conditions system to be used for gains. Default is negative.

      • setEcalName

        public void setEcalName(String ecalName)

      • setReadoutThreshold

        public void setReadoutThreshold(int readoutThreshold)
        Threshold for readout-path hits. For 2014+ running this should always equal the trigger threshold.
        Parameters:
        readoutThreshold - Units of ADC counts, default of 10.

      • setScaleFactor

        public void setScaleFactor(double scaleFactor)
        Scale factor for trigger-path hit amplitudes. Only used for test run.
        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - Default of 1.

      • setTriggerThreshold

        public void setTriggerThreshold(int triggerThreshold)
        Threshold for trigger-path hits. For 2014+ running this should always equal the readout threshold.
        Parameters:
        triggerThreshold - Units of ADC counts, default of 10.

      • setEcalReadoutCollectionName

        public void setEcalReadoutCollectionName(String ecalReadoutCollectionName)
        Output collection name for readout-path hits.
        Parameters:
        ecalReadoutCollectionName -

      • setNumSamplesAfter

        public void setNumSamplesAfter(int numSamplesAfter)
        Number of ADC samples to process after each rising threshold crossing. In FADC documentation, "number of samples after" or NSA.
        Parameters:
        numSamplesAfter - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 30.

      • setNumSamplesBefore

        public void setNumSamplesBefore(int numSamplesBefore)
        Number of ADC samples to process before each rising threshold crossing. In FADC documentation, "number of samples before" or NSB.
        Parameters:
        numSamplesBefore - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 5.

      • setReadoutLatency

        public void setReadoutLatency(int readoutLatency)
        Start of readout window relative to trigger time (in readout cycles). In FADC documentation, "Programmable Latency" or PL.
        Parameters:
        readoutLatency - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 100.

      • setReadoutWindow

        public void setReadoutWindow(int readoutWindow)
        Number of ADC samples to read out. In FADC documentation, "Programmable Trigger Window" or PTW.
        Parameters:
        readoutWindow - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 100.

      • setCoincidenceWindow

        public void setCoincidenceWindow(int coincidenceWindow)
        Number of clock cycles for which the same trigger-path hit is sent to the clusterer. Only used for old clusterer simulations (CTPClusterDriver). Otherwise this should be set to 1.
        Parameters:
        coincidenceWindow - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 1.

      • setUse2014Gain

        public void setUse2014Gain(boolean use2014Gain)
        Switch between test run and 2014 definitions of gain constants. True for MC studies and mock data in 2014. For all real data (test run and 2014+), test run MC, and 2015+ production MC, this should be false.
        Parameters:
        use2014Gain - True ONLY for simulation studies in 2014. Default of false.

      • setPulseShape

        public void setPulseShape(String pulseShape)
        Model used for the preamp pulse shape.
        Parameters:
        pulseShape - ThreePole, DoubleGaussian, or CRRC. Default is ThreePole.

      • setTp

        public void setTp(double tp)
        Shaper time constant. Definition depends on the pulse shape. For the three-pole function, this is equal to RC, or half the peaking time.
        Parameters:
        tp - Units of ns, default of 9.6.

      • setPePerMeV

        public void setPePerMeV(double pePerMeV)
        Photoelectrons per MeV, used to calculate noise due to photoelectron statistics. Test run detector had a value of 2 photoelectrons/MeV; new 2014 detector has a value of 32.8 photoelectrons/MeV.
        Parameters:
        pePerMeV - Units of photoelectrons/MeV, default of 32.8.

      • setDelay0

        public void setDelay0(int delay0)
        Latency between threshold crossing and output of trigger-path hit to clusterer.
        Parameters:
        delay0 - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 32.

      • setBufferLength

        public void setBufferLength(int bufferLength)
        Length of analog pipeline.
        Parameters:
        bufferLength - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 100.

      • setPipelineLength

        public void setPipelineLength(int pipelineLength)
        Length of digital pipeline. The digital pipeline in the FADC is 2000 cells long.
        Parameters:
        pipelineLength - Units of 4 ns FADC clock cycles, default of 2000.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Mode for readout-path hits.
        Parameters:
        mode - 1, 2 or 3. Values correspond to the standard FADC mode numbers (1=raw, 2=pulse, 3=pulse integral).

      • getSignalMap

        public Map<Long,RingBuffer> getSignalMap()
        Return the map of preamp signal buffers. For debug only.
        Returns:
        the map of preamp signal buffers

      • getPipelineMap

        public Map<Long,FADCEcalReadoutDriver.FADCPipeline> getPipelineMap()
        Return the map of FADC pipelines. For debug only.
        Returns:
        the map of FADC pipelines

      • readHits

        protected void readHits(List<RawCalorimeterHit> hits)
        Digitize values in the analog pipelines and append them to the digital pipelines. Integrate trigger-path hits and add them to the trigger path queues. Read out trigger-path hits to the list sent to the clusterer.
        Specified by:
        readHits in class EcalReadoutDriver<RawCalorimeterHit>
        Parameters:
        hits - List to be filled by this method.

        Overrides:

        Overrides:
        readoutDeltaT in class TriggerableDriver
        Returns:
        time reference for hits written by this driver in response to a trigger

        protected void putHits(List<CalorimeterHit> hits)
        Fill the analog pipelines with the preamp pulses generated by hits in the ECal.
        Specified by:
        putHits in class EcalReadoutDriver<RawCalorimeterHit>
        Parameters:
        hits - ECal hits from SLIC/Geant4.

      • resetFADCBuffers

        private boolean resetFADCBuffers()

      • pulseAmplitude

        private double pulseAmplitude(double time,
                              long cellID)
        Returns pulse amplitude at the given time (relative to hit time). Gain is applied.
        Parameters:
        time - Units of ns. Relative to hit time (negative=before the start of the pulse).
        cellID - Crystal ID as returned by hit.getCellID().
        Returns:
        Amplitude, units of volts/GeV.

      • pulseAmplitude

        public static double pulseAmplitude(double time,
                                    FADCEcalReadoutDriver.PulseShape shape,
                                    double shapingTime)
        Returns pulse amplitude at the given time (relative to hit time).
        Parameters:
        time - Units of ns. Relative to hit time (negative=before the start of the pulse).
        Returns:
        Amplitude, units of inverse ns. Normalized so the pulse integral is 1.

      • funcGaus

        public static double funcGaus(double t,
                              double sig)

      • findChannel

        private EcalChannelConstants findChannel(long cellID)
        Convert physical ID to gain value.
        Parameters:
        cellID - (long)
        Returns:
        channel constants (EcalChannelConstants)
